comment: Sweet on the nose, wet leaves and light vanilla. Drinks smooth and the vermouth barrel finishing is evident. Spice up front and in back.
Huge peppery quick burn with leather notes. Above average
reminds me of a Manhattan. Heavy vermouth, dry and spicy on the back end
very rye-ish nose. floral and sweet. vermouth influence. smooth. sweet. this is fine neat, but I think this would be great in a cocktail. 7/6/18
Harsh any biting. Needed to tone it down with the addition of something sweet. I am a big fan of Vya Vermouth, so that is why i tried it. Should have checked the ratings first.
Not a fan, very syrupy wine taste. For me the vermouth is too forward, doesn't let the rye come through. Maybe better in a cocktail.

Spice presents itself immediately. A wave of red hots hits the palate with maybe a touch of caramel before giving way to the sticky sweet vermouth finish: grape, honey, and an almost cough syrup-like herbaceous bitterness. When this finally gives way it allows mint, parsley, more bitters, and heat to carry the flavor on it's way out.
Nose was off putting, black licorice and bandaid. Tastes much better. Big notes of vermouth but not overwhelming. Very solid, first taste of dads hat

N: Very light if any
P: Very sweet before it hits that herbal note. Probably the vermouth, either way it's trash.
F: Bitter and medicinal.
Odd perplexing vermouth at the end, but drinkable.
